title: Redesigning hotel organisational structures for an agile pandemic response
subtitle: To adapt and respond to the global COVID-19 pandemic, IHG needed to reimagine the way hotels have operated for decades.

challenge.summary: The COVID-19 pandemic caused an average revenue decrease of 87% across the hospitality industry. This meant IHG required a new fluid and scalable operational structure that needed to be designed at a grassroots level while connecting with changes to corporate management structures.

process.summary: Inastra facilitated the multidisciplinary project group through agile and design thinking methodologies to enable deeper understanding of the problem before rapidly testing and iterating potential solutions. This included navigating inherent biases and establishing a stakeholder engagement and management plan.

results.summary: The new structure has been deployed to 52 hotels across 5 geographic regions in Australasia, with implementation on track to achieve project KPIs. Elements of the restructure are also being rolled out company-wide and are set to remain in place post-COVID, redefining the way hotels have operated for decades.

testimonial.quote: With the engagement and support of the Inastra team our project group was able to develop a Minimum Viable Product within a very timebound deliverable window. We were then able to rapidly distribute to hotels across Australasia, providing the guidance required to make the changes needed and support ongoing implementation. Thank you for guiding us through the innovation process.
testimonial.name: Brenden Van Blerk
testimonial.title: Director, New Hotels - Australasia & Japan
